title: UN News | Global perspective Human stories
text: [ ](/en/story/2024/09/1154921) Lebanon crisis: 90,000 displaced in last 72 hours, warns refugee agency A new humanitarian crisis is unfolding at Lebanon’s border with Syria as thousands of people flee Israeli shelling linked to the war in Gaza, UN humanitarians said on Thursday, just as Israel premier Benyamin Netanyahu arrived in New York for the UN General Assembly. Top Curated Stories [Climate and Environment](/en/news/topic/climate-change) [ Stop global warming to turn the tide on sea level rise: UN Assembly President ](/en/story/2024/09/1154881) Featured [SDGs](/en/news/topic/sdgs)A groundbreaking art installation at UN Headquarters by renowned media artist Refik Anadol leverages artificial intelligence (AI) to raise awareness of the beauty and fragility of the world’s coral reefs and the urgent need to address the climate crisis. Photo Stories [Thousands descend on UN for busiest week of the year ](/en/gallery/1154986) Heads of State and government, diplomats, experts, activists and celebrities have been attending the High-Level week and annual general debate at UN Headquarters in New York. Also in the News [UN Affairs](/en/news/topic/un-affairs)As wars and crises dominate global headlines, leaders from small island developing States used the UN General Assembly platform to sound the alarm on climate change – their most pressing existential threat – warning that it is obliterating economies and livelihoods. [UN Affairs](/en/news/topic/un-affairs)Amid ongoing wars in Gaza, Ukraine, and Sudan – and the escalating risk of wider conflict in the Middle East – world leaders and senior UN officials at the General Assembly’s annual debate warned that deep geopolitical divisions are hindering progress on critical global challenges – from securing peace to climate change and UN reform. Many stressed however, that a better future for all lay in decisive and united multilateral action and commitment to the ideals of the UN Charter.
